COMPENSATE.Definition: give something in return for a loss

CELL.Definition: a small room where a prisoner is kept

OVERCROWDED.Definition: having too many people in one space

SANITARY.Definition: relating to the conditions that affect hygiene and health

ACQUITTED.Definition: found not guilty of a crime in a court of law

BILL.Definition: a proposed law that was discussed before being accepted

QUAKER.Definition: a member of a christian group known for peaceful beliefs and simple living

ENSHRINED.Definition: made official or protected by law

UTILITARIANISM.Definition: the belief that actions are right if they benefit the most people

AWAKENING.Definition: a moment of becoming aware of something important

REDEMPTION.Definition: forgiveness or making up for mistakes

ACROSS THE POND.Definition: on the other side of the Atlantic Ocean

REFORMS.Definition: changes made to improve the system
